enamel.simulator

Class BrailleCell

  • java.lang.Object
    • enamel.simulator.BrailleCell

  • public class BrailleCell
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a Braille Cell with 8 pins. The class contains methods for displaying letters on the cell as well as raising and/or lowering individual pins.

    This class supports the standard Braille encoding of English characters plus the space character using the displayCharacter() method. For any non-standard characters or ones that aren't included by default, use the setPins() method, which takes a string of 1s and 0s as argument and sets the pins accordingly. 1 meaning raised and 0 meaning lowered. The constructor of this class is not public. Objects are created when a Simulator object is created. Use the getCell method of class Simulator to obtain references to individual BrailleCell objects.

    Author:
    Team 4: Yassin Mohamed, Qassim Allauddin, Derek Li, Artem Solovey.

    • Method Detail

      • displayCharacter

        public void displayCharacter(char a)
        Displays the character passed as argument on this Braille Cell object in Braille.

        The method works by selecting specific radio buttons that represent raised "pins", or the parts of the letter that would be felt by a human hand.

        Parameters:
        a - the character to be displayed in Braille
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the character isn't part of the standard alphabet or a space character.

      • setPins

        public void setPins(java.lang.String pins)
        Takes an eight character string of 1s and 0s as argument, and sets the the 8 pins accordingly. 1 corresponds to raising the pin, 0 to lowering it. The first character corresponds to the top-left pinn, the next character corresponding to the next pin from left to right and top to bottom.
        Parameters:
        pins - string of 1s and 0s that is 8 characters long that sets the state of the eight pins that form the cell
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the string is not 8 characters long or if it contains any character that isn't a 1 or a 0

      • raiseOnePin

        public void raiseOnePin(int pin)
        Raises the pin that corresponds to the argument.
        Parameters:
        pin - the index of the pin to raise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is not between 1 and 8 inclusive

      • lowerOnePin

        public void lowerOnePin(int pin)
        Lowers the pin that corresponds to the argument.
        Parameters:
        pin - the index of the pin to lower
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is not between 1 and 8 inclusive

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Lowers all the pins in the cell.

        This is equivalent to displayLetter(' ') .
